description.plain: Jay Wayne Jenkins (born September 28, 1977), better known by his stage name Jeezy or Young Jeezy, is an American rapper from Atlanta, Georgia. In 1998, he launched the label imprint CTE World. Aside from his solo career, Jeezy is the de facto leader of the southern hip hop group United Streets Dopeboyz of America (USDA), and is a former member of the Bad Boy Records' rap group Boyz n da Hood.

songs.title: I Do

description.plain:
Last track on TM 103: Hustlerz Ambition

The song focuses around marriage:


Young Jeezy talks about his relationship with the crack game
Jay-Z talks about his marriage to the streets and the crack game
Andre 3000 talks about marrying the woman of his dreams



This song has absolutely NOTHING in common with this one – well, except for the central metaphor, the subject matter, the feel, and one of the performers.

songs.full_title: Seen It All by Jeezy (Ft. JAY-Z)
songs.title: Seen It All

description.plain:
“Seen It All” is the second single from Jeezy’s July 2014 album. The song peaked at #84 on the US Billboard Hot 100 and #24 on the US Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs.

Jeezy teams up with Jay Z another round as they showcase their rhyming ability going over this lush production vividly depicting all their past experiences in the drug game.

songs.title: R.I.P.

description.plain:
“R.I.P.” is a song that can be found on Young Jeezy’s “It’s Tha World” mixtape. It is track #8 on the mixtape, and can be considered a single for the mixtape as the song gets moderate airplay on urban radio stations.

The song features 2 Chainz on the 3rd verse and it was produced by DJ Mustard.

songs.full_title: Put On by Jeezy (Ft. Kanye West)
songs.title: Put On

description.plain:
“Put On” sees Jeezy and Kanye West discussing various ways they put on for their cities; Atlanta and Chicago, respectively.

Jeezy’s two 12 bar verses include several food references and cover topics such as cars and selling drugs. Kanye’s verse uses the Auto-Tune effect that was also heavily used on his 808s & Heartbreak album, which was released a few months after “Put On”.

songs.title: Go Crazy

description.plain:
“Go Crazy” is the third single from Young Jeezy’s debut album Let’s Get It: Thug Motivation 101, featuring a guest appearance from his Def Jam Recordings boss Jay-Z. The two form a dope boy anthem that features them waxing poetic about the possibilities of what someone can achieve, even if they come from the streets.

Produced by Don Cannon, the track samples the song “(Man, Oh Man) I Want To Go Back” by The Impressions. “Go Crazy” peaked at #22 on the Billboard “Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs” chart. Pitchfork listed it as the 359th best song of the 2000s.

songs.full_title: All There by Jeezy (Ft. Bankroll Fresh)
songs.title: All There

description.plain:
https://twitter.com/Jeezy/status/784759015326613505

“All There” is a trap anthem that explores how Jeezy and Bankroll Fresh have all the drugs one may want to buy. From cocaine to weed, they create a catchy hook and hard verses speaking on their drug hustling ways.

This is the follow up single after  “Let Em Know” which makes fans more in-tuned to his anticipated album, Trap or Die 3.

songs.title: Holy Ghost

description.plain:
In this song Young Jeezy talks about how a young kid from the  “trap” the ghetto is surrounded by poverty, drugs and violence. Due to being poor, the only thing the young nigga knows is drug dealing. It’s the “thug in em'.” (Famous quote by 2Pac)

But living the life of crime, you will be surrounded by jealousy, greed and envy in the game.

songs.title: Put On (Remix)

description.plain:
In this Drumma Boy-produced remix (Kanye, not Jay-Z, was on the original), Jeezy and Jay-Z make one thing clear: They “Put On” for their city! (Jeezy puts on for Atlanta and Jay-Z for New York, specifically Brooklyn)

“Putting on” can mean estimably representing one’s city, doing charitable acts, or watching out for the well-being of the people from your neighborhood

Jay-Z and Young Jeezy collaborate well, including in “As Real as it Gets” on Jay’s latest, Blueprint 3

body.plain:
In this Drumma Boy-produced remix (Kanye, not Jay-Z, was on the original), Jeezy and Jay-Z make one thing clear: They “Put On” for their city! (Jeezy puts on for Atlanta and Jay-Z for New York, specifically Brooklyn)

“Putting on” can mean estimably representing one’s city, doing charitable acts, or watching out for the well-being of the people from your neighborhood

Jay-Z and Young Jeezy collaborate well, including in “As Real as it Gets” on Jay’s latest, Blueprint 3

songs.title: OJ

description.plain:
Jeezy gets Renegaded by Funeral Fab and Al Qaeda Jada, despite Kiss' lame-ass “gloves don’t fit” pun.

This is Track Number 3 from Young Jeezy’s fourth studio album and sixth overall album Thug Motivation 103:Hustler’s ambition released on December 20th, 2011. In line of a possible controversy since the track invokes the name of the pro football Hall-of-Famer O.J. Simpson, who was famously acquitted of murdering his wife, Jeezy cleared the air.

songs.title: Trap Star

description.plain: “Trap Star” is Young Jeezy’s 3rd single off his debut album “Let’s Get It: Thug Motivation 101”. The official video for this song was split in 2. The first part of the video was “Trap Star” and the 2nd half of the video was Go Crazy. They were both official singles, but “Go Crazy” was the song that got more radio play than “Trap Star”.

songs.title: Stay Strapped

description.plain:
Stay Strapped is a diss track released by Young Jeezy following a feud that developed between himself and fellow Atlanta rapper Radric Davis a.k.a Gucci Mane.

Jeezy and Gucci collaborated on the song “Icy” (produced by Zaytoven) in late 2004. The beef began when Jeezy was unable to put the track on his debut album Let’s Get It: Thug Motivation 101. The song appeared on Gucci Mane’s debut album Trap House in 2005. It was also reported that Jeezy was never paid royalties for his verse on Icy.
In Stay Strapped, Jeezy offers a $10,000 reward to anyone who can steal Gucci’s Icy chain. Just before Gucci released his Trap House album in 2005, he was attacked at gunpoint by four men who attempted to steal his chain. Gucci was able to hold off the attackers and even shot and killed one of the assailants in the process.
